Posts.Title: the blankets are officially pulled over my head lukejessesmom

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2013 05:17AM JoyE1947 wrote: ZippyDee: Last summer I was in a similar place as  your mother - I just could not eat.  I have never been a picky eater but I could not get anything down.  I wasn't nauseous, just felt so full and nothing tasted right.  I was very ill a t the time b/c my first chemo, Navelbine, did not agree with my body.  I ended up on TPN feedings (through my port) for several weeks, started in the hospital and then my husband was taught to hook me up at home.  Those feedings kept my weight stable and slowly I got my appetite back.  Now I am feeling great and have a good appetite.  Hope your mom gets her appetite back soon. JoyE
Posts.Title: Help, having trouble eating. Survivor46 kayrnic

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2013 09:40AM JoyE1947 wrote: I was diagnosed in May 2012 with BC with mets to liver.  I had pain in my right side under ribs and in the back just below my right shoulder blade.  I was started on Navalbine and became very ill to the point where I was hospitalized for 10 days. I lost 30 lbs. I was on no chemo from July to the end of August when I started Xeloda.  Still on Xeloda and Herceptin and feeling great.  On the last CT scan they had to look hard to find any liver mets.  My labs are all within normal limits as is my CA 15-3. I have had no surgeries. None were mentioned for my liver I think because of the amount of lesions and how sick I was.  It might be considered later, I don't know.
Posts.Title: Who had mets in liver only or liver first? curveball curveball

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2013 11:39AM JoyE1947 wrote: I am a new member having joined earlier in January 2013.  I was diagnosed Stage IV with liver mets in May 2012.  I am 65 years old and worked for many years as a medical transcriptionist and insurance biller.  I was married to my first husband 34 years and we had two children who are now 43 and 39.  They each have two children.  My husband died in 2001 at the age of 55 from c diff complications.  I remarried in 2005 to a wonderful man who has been by my side every step of the way on this cancer journey.  He has three grown children and together we have 10 grandchildren. We are both retired and are looking forward to a week in Florida in February. These forums are great source of support!

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2013 06:15PM JoyE1947 wrote: Golden girl, Sorry to hear of the difficulties your sister is having.  How is her appetite?  Just wondering if she is losing weight despite eating nutritious food. Joy
Posts.Title: Chemo weight loss goldengirl12 K-Lo

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2013 06:38PM JoyE1947 wrote: I can tell you my experience.  I was diagnosed in May 2012, stage IV with mets to the liver.  My liver was enlarged and my labs related to liver function were abnormal.  I was feeling very ill.  I lost 30 lbs. between May and July and was hospitalized twice.  I just could not get food down, liquids or solids, and was going downhill fast.  My husband insisted that I be fed "formula" through my port.  They call it TPN (total parental nutrition).  They started this in the hospital and I continued it at home, starting with home health nursing and then my husband was taught how to "hook me up". It is very expensive, you would have to check if her insurance covers it.  It worked wonders for me - I was on it for several weeks.  Finally when I could take in enough calories on my own it was discontinued.  I feel just great now!  If you need more info let me know or send me a provate message. Joy
Posts.Title: Chemo weight loss goldengirl12 K-Lo

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2013 09:33AM JoyE1947 wrote: Hi!   I have liver mets but not bone mets.  I am on my 11th cycle of Xeloda.  If you are not familiar with Xeloda it is taken orally in pill form.  It has been very successful for me and the dosage can be adjusted to your tolerance.  Very mild side effects for me but some women experience fatigue and hand/foot syndrome.  I am also on Herceptin. I hope you find an effective treatment that you tolerate well.

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2013 06:00PM JoyE1947 wrote: I found out the hard way to make sure your shoes are long enough and wide enough.  I had a pair of Skechers slip-ons that turned out to be too small for me.  We spent a day at Busch Gardens and by the end of the day I could barely walk.  My feet tend to swell some with Xeloda and I need to purchase a larger size than I normally wear.

I asked about it later and found out I was only supposed to drink one bottle. One lady described it as drinking Bath and Body lotion.

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2013 08:29AM JoyE1947 wrote: I was diagnosed with BC and liver mets in May of 2012.  I had mild pain on and off for a couple of weeks in my right side under my ribs and in my back on the right side just under the shoulder blade.  Suddenly the pain became severe and I went to the ER where they did a scan and found the liver mets.  I thought I had gall bladder pain or something like that.  It's better you find out right now and treatment can start.  Xeloda knocked my liver mets down and I feel great.

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2013 05:32PM JoyE1947 wrote: Soleil - Two or three staff in the ER also said my symptoms sounded gall bladder problems.  But when they did the scan the ER physician dropped the bomb that there were spots on my liver and it appeared to be cancer.

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2013 08:22AM JoyE1947 wrote: I am on my 8th round of Xeloda.  My SEs are very minimal.  I use Udderly Smooth on my hands and soles of my feet.  I started out on 1000 mg AM and 1000 mg PM in August 2012 and remain on that same dose.  I received an excellent reports from my CT scan and tumor markers earlier this month.  You might want to check with your onc about starting on a low dose to see how you tolerate it.
